alert.note: Alert for Guam (Guam) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 24 at 2:44PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM CHST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Chalan Pago, Windward Hills, parts of Talofofo and Tarzan Falls area * WHEN...Until 345 PM ChST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows will rise quickly. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 244 PM ChST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Chalan Pago, Windward Hills, parts of Talofofo and Tarzan Falls area - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
